remarks: Lemma B for ~ frgrancvvdeq .  This corresponds to statement 2 in [Huneke] p. 1:  "The map is one-to-one since z in N(x) is uniquely determined as the common neighbor of x and a(x)".  (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 23-Dec-2017.)
statement:
frgrancvvdeq.nx $e |- D = ( <. V , E >. Neighbors X ) $.
frgrancvvdeq.ny $e |- N = ( <. V , E >. Neighbors Y ) $.
frgrancvvdeq.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. V ) $.
frgrancvvdeq.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. V ) $.
frgrancvvdeq.ne $e |- ( ph -> X =/= Y ) $.
frgrancvvdeq.xy $e |- ( ph -> Y e/ D ) $.
frgrancvvdeq.f $e |- ( ph -> V FriendGrph E ) $.
frgrancvvdeq.a $e |- A = ( x e. D |-> ( iota_ y e. N { x , y } e. ran E ) ) $.
frgrancvvdeqlemB $p |- ( ph -> A : D -1-1-> ran A ) $.
$d D x y $.
$d E x y $.
$d N x y $.
$d V x y $.
$d Y y $.
$d ph x y $.
